reference_textbooks: Management Information Systems: Managing the Digital Firm by Laudon & Laudon
course_description: Study of information systems in organizations, focusing on how technology enables business strategy and operations.

topics: Database Planning (Data Planning, Requirements Specification, Conceptual Design, Logical Design, Physical Design)
Chapter Objectives (Logical database design, Converting ER diagrams to relational tables, Need for data normalization)
E-R Model Entity and its attributes (Salesperson example, primary key)
Converting a Simple Entity (to a table)
Converting One-to-Many Relationship (Foreign key on the 'many' side)
Converting Many-to-Many Relationship (Three relational tables, intersection data/associative entity)
Normalization Forms (First, Second, and Third Normal Form examples)
